generation

Interface MazeConfiguration

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    MazeContainer

    public interface MazeConfiguration
    A MazeConfiguration encapsulates all relevant information about a maze that can be explored in a game. A maze has dimensions width and height.
    Author:
    pk

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getDistanceToExit(int x, int y)
      Tells how many steps it is from the given (x,y) coordinate to the exit position.
      int getHeight()
      Get the height of the maze.
      Cells getMazecells()
      Gets the cells which describe where walls are in the current maze.
      Distance getMazedists()
      Gets a distance object for this maze to describe for each position how many steps it is towards the exit.
      int[] getNeighborCloserToExit(int x, int y)
      Provides coordinates of a position adjacent to the given (x,y) position that has a distance to the exit that is less than the distance for the given (x,y) position.
      BSPNode getRootnode()
      Gets access to a tree of nodes for segments of walls which is used for drawing the currently visible part.
      int[] getStartingPosition()
      Provides coordinates (x,y) of the starting position for this maze.
      int getWidth()
      Get the width of the maze.
      boolean hasWall(int x, int y, CardinalDirection dir)
      Tells if one faces a wall at position (x,y) looking into the given direction.

      Tells if (x,y) coordinate is within range.

      Set the height of the maze.

      Sets the tree of nodes for segments of walls.

    • Method Detail

      • setWidth

        void setWidth(int width)
        Set the width of the maze.
        Parameters:
        width - is greater or equal zero.

      • setHeight

        void setHeight(int height)
        Set the height of the maze.
        Parameters:
        height - is greater or equal zero.

      • getHeight

        int getHeight()
        Get the height of the maze.
        Returns:
        the height

      • getWidth

        int getWidth()
        Get the width of the maze.
        Returns:
        the width

      • getMazecells

        Cells getMazecells()
        Gets the cells which describe where walls are in the current maze.
        Returns:
        the mazecells

      • setMazecells

        void setMazecells(Cells mazecells)
        Sets the cells which describe where walls are in the current maze.
        Parameters:
        mazecells - the mazecells to set

      • getMazedists

        Distance getMazedists()
        Gets a distance object for this maze to describe for each position how many steps it is towards the exit.
        Returns:
        the mazedists

      • setMazedists

        void setMazedists(Distance mazedists)
        Sets the distance values towards the exit for this maze. Note that the dimensions of the distance matrix needs to match with the cells.
        Parameters:
        mazedists - the distances to set

      • getRootnode

        BSPNode getRootnode()
        Gets access to a tree of nodes for segments of walls which is used for drawing the currently visible part.
        Returns:
        the rootnode

      • setRootnode

        void setRootnode(BSPNode rootnode)
        Sets the tree of nodes for segments of walls.
        Parameters:
        rootnode - the rootnode to set

      • isValidPosition

        boolean isValidPosition(int x,
                        int y)
        Tells if (x,y) coordinate is within range.
        Parameters:
        x - is on the horizontal axis
        y - is on the vertical axis
        Returns:
        true if 0 <= x < width, 0 <= y < height

      • getDistanceToExit

        int getDistanceToExit(int x,
                      int y)
        Tells how many steps it is from the given (x,y) coordinate to the exit position.
        Parameters:
        x - is on the horizontal axis, 0 <= x < width
        y - is on the vertical axis, 0 <= y < height
        Returns:
        the length of path to the exit

      • hasWall

        boolean hasWall(int x,
                int y,
                CardinalDirection dir)
        Tells if one faces a wall at position (x,y) looking into the given direction. Note that the cardinal direction is absolute and not relative to the current direction such as right or left.
        Parameters:
        x - is on the horizontal axis, 0 <= x < width
        y - is on the vertical axis, 0 <= y < height
        dir - is the direction in terms of North, East, South, West
        Returns:
        true if (x,y) is valid and there is a wall in the given direction, false otherwise

      • getNeighborCloserToExit

        int[] getNeighborCloserToExit(int x,
                              int y)
        Provides coordinates of a position adjacent to the given (x,y) position that has a distance to the exit that is less than the distance for the given (x,y) position. For a maze that has a solution for (x,y) such a position always exists with the exception of the exit position.
        Parameters:
        x - is on the horizontal axis, 0 <= x < width
        y - is on the vertical axis, 0 <= y < height
        Returns:
        int array of length 2 with (x',y') coordinates for neighbor

      • getStartingPosition

        int[] getStartingPosition()
        Provides coordinates (x,y) of the starting position for this maze. Maze generation algorithms are expected to use the position that is the farthest away from the exit as the starting position, i.e., the one with the maximum distance.

      • setStartingPosition

        void setStartingPosition(int x,
                         int y)
        Sets coordinates (x,y) of the starting position for this maze. Maze generation algorithms are expected to use the position that is the farthest away from the exit as the starting position, i.e., the one with the maximum distance.
        Parameters:
        x - is on the horizontal axis, 0 <= x < width
        y - is on the vertical axis, 0 <= y < height
